column4: hello all need some help installing ubuntu. i would really like to dual boot my windows machine but i dont want to over write my mbr for my windows partition by installing grub. is there a way i can install an ubuntu partition without tanking my windows mbr?
windows is more than comfortable being booted from grub.
ever time i have dual booted and wanted to uninstal ubuntu my windows mbr freaks out. how do you recomend repairing it if i decided later i dont want to run a dual booted machine?
and you can backup your mbr if you want to restore it, it just "tanks" the ability to boot ubuntu. Windows disks have the ability to make the drive purely windows mbr again.
